level.heading: Bylaws - Contents.
level.text: The bylaws may, within the limitations of this chapter, provide for the:
Method and terms of admission to membership and the disposal of members' interests on cessation of membership for any reason;
Time, place, and manner of calling and conducting meetings;
Number or percentage of the members constituting a quorum;
Number, qualifications, powers, duties, term of office, and manner, time, and vote for election, of directors and officers; and
Division or classification, if any, of directors to provide for rotating or overlapping terms;
Compensation, if any, of the directors, and the number of directors necessary to constitute a quorum;
Method of distributing the net savings; or
Various discretionary provisions of this chapter as well as other provisions incident to the purposes and activities and affairs of the association.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 substituted "activities and affairs" for "activities" in (7).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
